definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
Maritime Day (July 11th) commemorating the first voyage of Zheng He 鄭和|郑和[Zheng4 He2] in 1405 AD

pinyin: Ban4 dao3 he2 dong1 fang1 hang2 hai3

definition: to have a long and hard journey (idiom)

sentences.english: To remember terms on aids to navigation and nautical publication.
sentences.chinese: 有關助航儀器和航海出版物的術語。

sentences.english: Fill up Maritime Declaration of Health.
I bought him a model of ship.
sentences.chinese: 我給他買了一艘航海模型。

sentences.english: A marine biologist then sets out to destroy the creature by training two killer whales to go after the slimy menacer .
sentences.chinese: 一個航海專家開始訓練兩隻鯨魚去打敗這隻威脅者。

sentences.english: The compass was widely used in ancient China for navigational purposes.
sentences.chinese: 指南針在中國古代廣泛應用於航海。

sentences.english: Fossett focused on sailing and aviation.
sentences.chinese: 佛施特的興趣焦點放在航海。

sentences.english: Demonstrate the viewpoint again by navigation model boat design practice accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 通過航海模型運動產品的設計實踐來驗證文中觀點。

sentences.english: Records of Zheng He's incredible voyages were burned.
sentences.chinese: 鄭和令人驚歎的航海紀錄也遭焚燬湮滅。

sentences.english: We also wish to demonstrate that rafts can be navigated.
sentences.chinese: 我們也希望證明筏子是能夠航海的。

sentences.english: The advantages of the old paper logbook should be combined with the power of a computer.
sentences.chinese: 舊的紙版航海日誌的優點將被組合在計算機的功能中。

sentences.english: So it seems that even more ancient proto-human species knew how to sail.
sentences.chinese: 看來似乎更早期的原始人類已經知道如何航海了。

sentences.english: In the captain's cabin behind the bridge he found the ship's log.
sentences.chinese: 在橋樓後面的船長室中，他找到了這艘船的航海日誌。

sentences.english: It was commonly used by Chinese seafarers travelling along the Malay peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 它成了馬來半島一帶中國船隻普遍使用的航海儀器。

sentences.english: Right now, my wife and friends are sailing.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，我的妻子和朋友們正在航海。

sentences.english: Living after an aim is like captaining after a ambit.
sentences.chinese: 生活不目標就像航海沒有羅盤。

sentences.english: The most valuablefindof all was the ship 's log book.
sentences.chinese: 打撈到的東西中最有價值的是船上的航海日誌。

definition: to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
the West (Europe and North America)/countries of the Indian Ocean (traditional)
